newsitem.title: GABON: Zaire's Mobutu goes into Gabon mini-summit.
newsitem.headline: Zaire's Mobutu goes into Gabon mini-summit.

text.p: Zaire's President Mobutu Sese Seko went into a mini-summit in Gabon on Thursday with a group of fellow French-speaking African leaders, witnesses said.
Witnesses said Mobutu arrived at 11.05 a.m. (1005 GMT) and embraced Gabonese President Omar Bongo, who is hosting the talks, outside the presidential palace before walking inside on a red carpet.

Heads of state of Congo, Central African Republic, Equatorial Guinea and Chad also arrived at the palace. Cameroon, currently chairing the Organisation of African Unity (OAU), was represented by its foreign minister.
The mini-summit follows a weekend meeting hosted on a ship in Congo by South African President Nelson Mandela which ended without agreement between Mobutu and rebel leader Laurent Kabila.
Kabila's rebels who took up arms in October have vowed to attack the Zairean capital Kinshasa if Mobutu does not stand down.
